When using rgba-background, the rounded borders get (partly) transparent as well, even though no transparency has been set for the borders. On the example-URL this is best visible on the bottom-side corners

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1. create iframe with rgba-background, border and border-radius

Actual Results:  
borders become (partly) transparent on the corners

Expected Results:  
No transparency should be applied to the border-corners

 Chome: FAIL
IE 7/8: FAIL (no support for border-radius)
  IE 9: OK

comments.raw_text: Hmm.  I wonder whether this is some sort of antialiasing effect.  The transparency is only applied to the outer few px of the border (e.g. if you set the border width to 10px you can see this).
